protocol_name: Creation of an isolate: PA and FL microbes from whole water
protocol_name_html: Creation of an isolate: PA and FL microbes from whole water
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8dvp6","text":"Pre-filter the water with a 20 \u00b5m mesh net and fill a clean carboy with several liters of this <20 \u00b5m-filtered water. You are filtering 500mL, collect at least 1 liters (~30% more than needed for filtration) at this stage to ensure enough water for system flushing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7D5204A0C74811E8B45B5193D2F5F960","id":671085,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Collect Water "}

{"blocks":[{"key":"437bq","text":"Using a parastolic pump (procedure for usage of this apperatus can be found in Sampling water for microbial and viral counts by Melissa Duhaime.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":128,"length":15,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"25pfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1dalj","text":"Generally we will use the pump with one inline filiter that is 3 micron. We will use our prefiltered whole water, and we will collect about 500mL of the <3 micron (FL sample) water sample in an epandorf tube, and we will take the 3 micron filter (PA sample) and we will roll the filter so the \"dirty\" side faces out and we suspended it in about 50uL of 1XPBS in an epandorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/researchers\/melissa-duhaime"}}],"guid":"CE50BA90C74811E8B45B5193D2F5F960","id":671086,"previous_guid":"7D5204A0C74811E8B45B5193D2F5F960","section":"Separating particle associated (PA) and free-living microbes (FL)"}
steps.section: Separating particle associated (PA) and free-living microbes (FL)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gmrp","text":"Preferably rapidly after collection you should begin to prepare your samples for culture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cghp6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7u8eb","text":"For the PA sample, take the tube with the filter paper and vortex it for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Then using sterlie forecps pull filter paper slightly out of the tube resecure the cap of the tube and then centrifuge sample for 3 minutes. Then remove the filter paper, vortex and pippette up and down to resuspend cell pellet. Plate 50uL of resuspended sample on to four plate types: TSA, BG11, LB and Lake agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ers2b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sdto","text":"For FL sample, vortex sample for 30 seconds and then plate 50uL of sample on to the four plate types: TSA, BG11, LB and Lake ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cufe4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F7CE90D0C74911E8B45B5193D2F5F960","id":671088,"previous_id":671086,"previous_guid":"CE50BA90C74811E8B45B5193D2F5F960","section":"Preparing for culture "}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48am6","text":"After plates have grown for 2 or 3 days we should see a lawn of several different colony formations. Isolate unique colony morphologies for each plate and streak them out on to a new plate of the same type. (TSA parent plate -> TSA daughter plate). We collected up to 5 different colony morphologies for each parent plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4qmua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"176ee","text":"After the streaks had grown out (another 2 to 3 days) we then streaked isolated colonies again (if two colonies where present we then split them and plated one of each). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqt55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6du9g","text":"We restreaked the colonies for 3 generations until we were certain of purity of colony. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40ghi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4qloe","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"chuju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"30785","guid":"D888F8D0C74B11E88649FB9FC90FB21D","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/8cb2wvw.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"Screen Shot 2018-10-03 at 4.32.18 PM.png","mime":"image\/png","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}}],"guid":"C77C7590C74A11E8B45B5193D2F5F960","id":671089,"previous_id":671088,"previous_guid":"F7CE90D0C74911E8B45B5193D2F5F960","section":"Isolation of Colonies "}
